text: [Music]
Philip has been talking like this for
decades now and um the fact is he keeps
writing books and people keep reading
them and um and I I I just I disagree
strenuously um human beings need stories
um and we're we're looking for them in
all kinds of places whether it's
television whether it's comic books or
movies or radio plays whatever whatever
form um people are hungry for stories
children I mean think of your own
childhood how how how important the
bedtime story was how important these
imaginary experiences were for you they
help shape reality and I think human
beings uh wouldn't be human without
narrative fiction
okay perhaps uh you know the the the
market the way the way things are moving
fewer people are reading novels than
than
previously but still if you walk into a
bookstore there are thousands upon
thousands of them there and um they
wouldn't be in print unless somebody was
buying them um libraries are cramped
with novels as well and people are
reading them and uh I don't think it's
ever going to dry up because two the
novel is such a flexible form it's not
like a sonnet it's not fixed uh you can
do anything you want with it it's just a
a story that you
tell uh within the covers of a book but
all all bets are off there are no rules
and um and that's why I think the novel
is constantly Reinventing itself and
Society continues to reinvent itself
every historical moment needs the
stories to be told about it so much as I
admire Philip Roth I I just think he's
wrong about
this well I know it's changing already
or at least there are new things that
have been happening uh but it even goes
back 10 20 years now hypertex Bob couver
doing all all these things with
computers and multiple narrators of
stories multiple authors of stories I
should say um I don't know I don't know
I'm not a a a a a man deeply interested
in technology it eludes me I confess I
don't even have a computer I don't have
a cell phone
um but I did read recently about a um a
new digital magazine uh doing very short
stories that people can read on their
telephones maybe this is interesting
maybe not um I think people are trying
out ideas with the new technology and um
it's too early to say where it's going
exactly but but again whether it's
digital or paper it doesn't matter it's
words that somebody is reading and
getting an experience out of that
reading that's that's all that really
matters
